text: Episcopal Church --- Christmas Eve Midnight Mass 2013 (11pm-12:30am) - taken by Lindsay Ghee St. Michael and All Angels Episcopal Church is an historic church located at 1000 West 18th Street in Anniston, Alabama, designed by architect William Halsey Wood of Newark, NJ. It was added to the Alabama Register of Landmarks and Heritage on November 23, 1976 and to the National Register of Historic Places on March 14, 1978. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Calhoun County, Alabama ==References== ==External links== * St. Michael and All Angels website Category:National Register of Historic Places in Calhoun County, Alabama Category:Churches on the National Register of Historic Places in Alabama Category:Episcopal church buildings in Alabama Category:Gothic Revival church buildings in Alabama Category:Properties on the Alabama Register of Landmarks and Heritage Category:Churches in Calhoun County, Alabama
title: St. Michael and All Angels Episcopal Church (Anniston, Alabama)
